Reviews.Title: “Best Value at the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Dave T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from September thru December 2011 having recently relocated to the area and looking for a long term apartment. I will attest to the fact that while the rooms are not the Ritz Carlton (this is a beach place), you simply cannot find a better deal at the beach. Located in a nice area it is surrounded by a handful of restaurants, a grocery store, and two of the few gas stations in the area; The Beachcomber is close enough, but yet far enough away from the nightlife PB has to offer. It is a short 2.5 block walk down to the world famous Tourmaline Surf Park and at the base of La Jolla's Mt. Soledad. The beaches of La Jolla and Pacific Beach, Crystal Pier, Belmont Park, Sea World, and Downtown San Diego are all within a few miles or less. For the person who is looking for an inexpensive place to stay, who plans on seeing the sights and not huddling in their hotel room (who does that anyway), this is an excellent deal at less than $300 per week. The staff is very attentive and there for you whenever you need them. I've even seen them helping tenants out at midnight. The two women who work in the office were absolutely of the best caliber. They really care about this place, and are intent on making your stay enjoyable. I would definitely recommend the Beachcomber for anyone who is traveling through the area and wants to stay at the beach without forking over hundreds of dollars a night. Keep in mind, this is a beach place and should be considered as such. Think about your home town. What type of room do you get at a discounted rate of less than $40 per night. This is as nice or nicer. Enjoy your stay, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “"Don't expect the 'Hilton' .. good value for a WEEKLY studio-type room"”
Reviews.Author: dtabse
Reviews.Content: I had lived in Pacific Beach before and upon moving back needed an affordable and convenient place to stay while in 'transition' looking for housing rentals. Yes, it is older and is not going to suit everyone.. . The rate for a week was $250+tax/100 cash deposit. (which was refunded). That's about $40/day which is very reasonable. Roomy, clean, friendly with free Wi-Fi, queen bed, tile floor, mini-frig, cable t.v. & two-top gas stove top. Walking distance to eateries, little shops, 24-hr mart, and grocery store. About 2 blocks to the beach. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a bargain and are okay without needing fancy upgrades. I rather enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “NICE place GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: hang21
Reviews.Content: PERFECT north Pacific Beach location.. Close to all; the beach, Sea World, shopping, TONS of food, Zoo, etc. EASY walk to local beaches along with some of the very BEST sunsets in So. CA... Nice and PROFESSIONAL STAFF, including an occasional visit from the owners .. I'll be back FOR SURE ! Many THANKS Beachcomer Shores :} ..

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie211
Reviews.Content: This place is a complete dump. Not only are the rooms a joke; dirty linens with stains, carpeting that smells, showers that barely have pressure, very loud with kids & traffic, et al., the staff is comprised with ex-druggies who lack teeth and are very unpleasant. They conduct in illegal activity for long term stays. BE WARNED: If you stay more than 28 days they insist you move to another room. THIS IS COMPLETELY ILLEGAL ACCORDING TO SAN DIEGO HOUSING AUTHORITY. If they ask you to do this, you can be awarded $500 by turning them into San Diego authorities. Do not let them get away with this illegal maneuver. They are VERY unfriendly to foreign guests. They advertise free Wi-Fi - Only about 3 rooms get a signal and those are REALLY slow. Street noise is very loud and a bar next door plays very loud music until late at night. Avoid this place!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer service”
Reviews.Author: cntrycali
Reviews.Content: Wow this place is great. Front office staff is awesome. They were very friendly and quiet knowledgeable. They went out of their way to make sure my stay was nothing but the best. Very clean rooms, clean sheets and towels. All windows were sparkling and they have the cleanest bathrooms I have seen yet. Not to mention the landscaping beautiful jobs. All rooms look like they were just painted. You could not ask for more. There is a variety of eating places including pizza.burgers,tacos and even The French Gourmet Restaurant it is to die for. There is a grocery store,bakery, laundry mat ,several gift shops and even yes a Chocolate store. There is nothing more you could want, honest. This is a great place to come and get away and just relax... No one ever bothers you wow how awesome is that. This is a great place for a awesome price in PB. Thank you to all the staff for all help it was greatly appreciated. I will be back in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: SHOULD BE CALLED CRACKCOMEBER SHORES”
Reviews.Author: K_JacobsFresno
Reviews.Content: My girl found their ad on Craigslist. I knew the rate for the week in the middle of summer just blocks from the beach had to be too good to be true! I should of been paid to stay there! -Rooms horribly decorated -Bed hard with springs poking out -No air condition -Janky windows -Dirty Carpet -Stained comforter -People openly doing drugs! -Children running around -Roach infested -Management is rude, unprofessional, I'm not sure what half way house they found them in -NO PARKING -We didn't even have drawers to put my clothes in Those are only the things I can think of off the top of my head. The place was swarming with shady looking characters. My girlfriend wouldn't stay in the room alone! This place shouldn't even be allowed to rent rooms! The only way I'd stay here is if I didn't have a car to sleep in. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Hanoi Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: pacificdays
Reviews.Content: Im a native of Oceanside living out of state and planned a trip to fly back in with my girlfriend to spend the 4th of July back home. Upon finding an ad on the San diego craigslist I found an ad for BeachComber Shores. When I first mailed in my payment to secure the room 3 months before flying in, I asked the management repeatedly to send me a receipt. Every time I called the attendant would give an excuse to why it had not been sent. Upon flying in to San Diego and Picking up my Car Rental, I drove to the property which was disgusting externally, we still wanted to give the place a chance maybe the inside would be more accomidable. I had to park the rental next to a trailer on bricks who probably pays for the lot space to live there. The on-site live-in attendant was kind enough to leave a note with a number so we can retrieve the key. . Only problem is she wrote down six digits instead of 7. Walking in the premesis the pungent smell of marajuana was obvious. We asked a group Cholo residents loitering in the cortyard If they knew where the landlord is, they were kind enough to help, after yelling "SHEILLLLLLAAAA" through her screen window, she emerged with no shoes on, and showed us to our rooms. We had the choice of one room, you can feel the floorboard underneath the carpet shift around while we inspected the room, the bed felt like a boxspring on top of a boxspring. The ad on craigslist gives the reason for the value on the rooms are because there is no room service and no air conditioning. I am accustomed to San diego weather so that was not a problem for me, only thing is 3 of the windows in the room were glued shut. the only ones we could open up were facing the street, we could hear every step a person or every cough a person made outside, let alone the sound of traffic. The windows were substandard it had some sort of archaic swing out contraption, it was evidentthe exterior of the complex was suffering from decay, must have not been remodeled since at least the early 60's. I was afraid to leave my lapotp there and belongings let alone my girlfriend there alone if I wanted to hit the waves surfing early morning. We stayed in the room a total of 1 hour since the time we checked in and the only other room that was vacant during the holiday was 20 miles away in Poway. The attendant denied us a refund due to the fact the Supervisor was unavailible durning Jul4th. We returned the next morning only to hear that $100 was to be subtracted from our refund, and it would be mailed to us. I did not even recieve a receipt how could I trust them to send me a refund? Management decided to argue with us, the most inconsiderate response came from the supervisor, "Unlike you two, not fulfilling your commitments we will fulfill ours and mail your refund" Never have I heard a businessperson question their customers character. After finally thretening legal action we obtained our refund minus the security deposit of $100 dollars. It felt so good to drive away from the shantytown wreck we nealy had to spend a whole nother week in, I give credit to those who could bear spending just one night in one of those rooms. Please dont be like me and ignore the negative posts online, take my loss as your gain and find some other place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location cheap price”
Reviews.Author: upwind
Reviews.Content: We needed an inexpensive apartment for 3 persons for Easter Break in the beach area of Pacific Beach...we found this on Craigslist advertised at $325/wk! It turned out to be a studio apartment and we paid extra for the third person. This was the best deal we could find. Location was great and close to beach and clubs. Parking was difficult, no room cleaning for weekly visits (you do your own). Staff was helpful but becuse it was weekly, we did not need them every day. Microwaves and bar frigs only....be prepared to npay the $100 security deposit..

Reviews.Title: “We endured a week smashing roaches...”
Reviews.Author: JenniferSnow
Reviews.Content: The Beachcomber Shores has a big banner out front saying "BEST RATES". They also runs ads without the hotel name but its phone number advertising cheap rates in the newspaper and other places. However the cheap advertised rate is never available when you inquire. Expect to pay $98 per night for a room after you take the bait and show up. The $250 and $275 a week rate is always "unavailable" as well. Expect to pay between $350 and $400. Its a classic bait and switch and they don't even try to hide it. They will tell you "Thats just an ad we run year round to attract coustomers." I stayed for a week watching cockroaches crawl up and down the walls. They said they were "spraying for BEES" and to stay indoors one day. They threatened to keep my $100 deposit several times. Once when I had a friend over (they spy for this 24 hours a day) and another time when someone said my TV was too loud. Overall it was a hellish nightmare and I would sleep in my car before I stayed there again. For the same price you can stay at much nicer hotels alot closer to the beach with many less restrictions and much friendlier service. Heads up folks!

Reviews.Title: “Good times, good stay”
Reviews.Author: funinfresno
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here for almost 2 weeks. It was definetly the best deal in town. Its only blocks to the beach. The main street where all the action takes place is walking distance. Perfect to be close enough to enjoy the bars and shops, but a nice distance away from the noise that takes place in the evening. The units have a small fridge and a microwave which was perfect for heating up left overs and late night snacks. The bus line is close by, making it easy acess to get downtown. The unit is more like an apartment than a motel room. There is no miad service, but all the supplies you need are available at the office. The staff was great! Very friendly and gave me great info on where to go in San Diego. I will for sure be back to visit. The place is perfect if you are looking for a great deal and want to spend money on San Diego, instead of expensive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beachcomber Shores the place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: judoboy7
Reviews.Content: If you want a great place to stay in San Diego, the Beachcomber Shores should be your first choice. A few blocks from the beach and from the multitude of shops and restaurants in Pacific Beach it's the perfect location. The staff is super efficient and great to look at too!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MsFlorida
Reviews.Content: The location is very convenient being close to the beach and everything else you'd need. Also the wireless internet was a nice amenity. You can't beat the price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Beach But Basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week in May. Rooms were basic but clean ...no pool, AC, or room service. Easy walk tobeach and surf.. Large market block away. The PB club area was also close by. Parking was a problem at nite...not emough. Paid $275 for week...couldn't find anything less nearby PB...watch out cuz they don't take pets or 4 persons in a room.

HotelInfo.Name: Beachcomber Shores
HotelInfo.Address: 907 Turquoise Street, San Diego, CA 92109
